abstract: The British bank added the former leaders of Interpol and the Swift bank messaging network and a former counterterrorism adviser to President George W. Bush.
snippet: The British bank added the former leaders of Interpol and the Swift bank messaging network and a former counterterrorism adviser to President George W. Bush.
lead_paragraph: The British bank Standard Chartered said on Monday that it had named three external advisers, including the former president of Interpol, to a new committee to oversee its compliance program, set up to identify and prevent financial crime.

headline.main: Standard Chartered Names 3 Advisers to Financial Crime Panel

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: SWIFT (Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication)
